content.description: The summit of The Castle is most easily reached from a variety of short routes on the SE aspect of the mountain.  From the small meadow/bench at ~6,200 ft, scramble to the base of the steeper climbing, and pick a line; options further east seem to be easier.  The summit Pinnacle has room for several people to safely hang out, and there are slings for a short rappel to the base.
content.protection: A small rack with a few pieces of protection in the finger to hand size will be sufficient.  Slings at top for anchor and rappel.
content.location: SE face route(s) are located above the small meadow/bench on the SE aspect of The Castle.  The easiest approach is from Pinnacle-Plummer saddle to the west, following a user trail below the S. face of Pinnacle peak, and then either scrambling directly up and over the small ridge, or dropping around it to the south.
